summary: This bill, the Combating Organized Retail Crime Act, aims to address organized retail crime and cargo theft. It amends Title 18 of the United States Code to provide law enforcement with more tools. It directs the establishment of an Organized Retail and Supply Chain Crime Coordination Center within the Department of Homeland Security to coordinate efforts between federal, state, and local agencies, and private sector entities, and requires reports to Congress. The Center will also focus on information sharing, training, and trend analysis, with the authority to sunset after 7 years.
